_header: When shall your cruel storms be passed
_description: A lover’s plea and his lady’s response — two 6-line stanzas

CamTCC1450.First Lines:
When shall your cruell sterneȝ be pastShall nott my truthe
                    your rigor slake…
CamTCC1450.Last Lines:
…now are no foole your wylye seruynsshall serue to fynde my
                    answere playne
CamTCC1450.Note:
Added in a hand of sixteenth century; two stanzas headed,
                    ‘Questio’ and ‘Responsio’.
